SEARCH
Package com.bookapp.service

Class BookImpl

java.lang.Object
com.bookapp.service.BookImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBook
public class BookImpl extends Object implements IBook
BookImpl is an implementation of the IBook interface. This class provides concrete implementations for managing a collection of books. It allows for adding books, retrieving them based on various criteria, and sorting them by different fields.

The class maintains an internal list of Book objects and provides methods to perform operations on this list. The operations include adding books, retrieving books by ID, title, author, category, or price, and sorting books by different fields.

Exception handling is integrated into the methods to provide meaningful messages when books are not found based on the search criteria.

Author:
MonigaBalasubramanian

      public List<Book> getBookById(int bookId) throws IdNotFoundException
      Retrieves a list of Book objects that match the specified book ID. Throws an IdNotFoundException if no books are found with the given ID.
      Specified by:
      getBookById in interface IBook
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • sortByAnyField

      public List<Book> sortByAnyField(String field)
      Sorts the list of Book objects based on the specified field.

      The sorting fields can be "Title", "ID", "Author", "Category", or "Price". If an invalid field is provided, it prints an error message.

      Specified by:
      sortByAnyField in interface IBook
      Parameters:
      field - The field by which to sort the books.
      Returns:
      A list of books sorted by the specified field.
